Package scheduling

Class Scheduler

  • java.lang.Object
    • scheduling.Scheduler

  • public class Scheduler
extends java.lang.Object
    This class represents the scheduler component within the simulation framework.
    Author:
    nilsw

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field Description
      private java.util.ArrayList<BatchJob> affectedSubmittedJobs
      List of all jobs that were submitted to the scheduler and were not able to be scheduled at the point in simulation time that is specified in the workload trace (only used when superMUCMode is on).
      private DemandFlexibilitySchedulingStrategy demandFlexSchedulingStrategy
      Scheduling strategy that is used to schedule power consumption adjustments during DR events.
      private DC handledDC
      DC instance to which this scheduler component belongs.
      private java.util.ArrayList<BatchJob> scheduledJobs
      List of all scheduled jobs.
      private SchedulingStrategy schedulingStrategy
      Scheduling strategy that is used to schedule to schedule the jobs when no power adjustments are required.
      private java.util.ArrayList<BatchJob> submittedJobs
      List of all jobs that were submitted to the scheduler component.

      • demandFlexSchedulingStrategy

        private DemandFlexibilitySchedulingStrategy demandFlexSchedulingStrategy
        Scheduling strategy that is used to schedule power consumption adjustments during DR events.

      • schedulingStrategy

        private SchedulingStrategy schedulingStrategy
        Scheduling strategy that is used to schedule to schedule the jobs when no power adjustments are required.

        DC instance to which this scheduler component belongs.

        List of all scheduled jobs.

        List of all jobs that were submitted to the scheduler component.

      • affectedSubmittedJobs

        private java.util.ArrayList<BatchJob> affectedSubmittedJobs
        List of all jobs that were submitted to the scheduler and were not able to be scheduled at the point in simulation time that is specified in the workload trace (only used when superMUCMode is on).

    • Method Detail

      • scheduleNextInterval

        public SchedulingResult scheduleNextInterval​(double powerAdjustmentHeight,
                                             ReserveProvisionType provisionType,
                                             int schedulingIntervalLength)
        Schedules the upcoming scheduling interval. This method is used for both, the scheduling of "normal" intervals and the scheduling of DR events.
        Parameters:
        powerAdjustmentHeight - Requested power adjustment height (in comparison to the current power consumption of the DC). 0 when a "normal" interval is scheduled.
        provisionType - Requested reserve provision type.
        schedulingIntervalLength - Length of the interval that is supposed to be scheduled.
        Returns:
        Result of the scheduling process.

      • scheduleNextIntervalForMaximumPowerDemand

        public void scheduleNextIntervalForMaximumPowerDemand​(int schedulingIntervalLength)
        Schedules the upcoming interval of the specified length, so that the maximum power demand is reached.
        Parameters:
        schedulingIntervalLength - Length of the interval for that the workload should be scheduled in simulation time.

      • scheduleNextIntervalForMaximumPowerDemandShiftingOnly

        public void scheduleNextIntervalForMaximumPowerDemandShiftingOnly​(int schedulingIntervalLength)
        Schedules the upcoming interval of the specified length, so that the maximum power demand, which can be reached only through workload shifting, is reached.
        Parameters:
        schedulingIntervalLength - Length of the interval for that the workload should be scheduled in simulation time.

      • scheduleNextIntervalForMaximumPowerDemandDVFSOnly

        public void scheduleNextIntervalForMaximumPowerDemandDVFSOnly​(int schedulingIntervalLength)
        Schedules the upcoming interval of the specified length, so that the maximum power demand, which can be reached only through frequency scaling, is reached.
        Parameters:
        schedulingIntervalLength - Length of the interval for that the workload should be scheduled in simulation time.

      • scheduleNextIntervalForMinimumPowerDemand

        public void scheduleNextIntervalForMinimumPowerDemand​(int schedulingIntervalLength)
        Schedules the upcoming interval of the specified length, so that the minimum power demand is reached.
        Parameters:
        schedulingIntervalLength - Length of the interval for that the workload should be scheduled in simulation time.

      • scheduleNextIntervalForMinimumPowerDemandShiftingOnly

        public void scheduleNextIntervalForMinimumPowerDemandShiftingOnly​(int schedulingIntervalLength)
        Schedules the upcoming interval of the specified length, so that the minimum power demand, which can be reached only through workload shifting, is reached.
        Parameters:
        schedulingIntervalLength - Length of the interval for that the workload should be scheduled in simulation time.

      • scheduleNextIntervalForMinimumPowerDemandDVFSOnly

        public void scheduleNextIntervalForMinimumPowerDemandDVFSOnly​(int schedulingIntervalLength)
        Schedules the upcoming interval of the specified length, so that the minimum power demand, which can be reached only through frequency scaling, is reached.
        Parameters:
        schedulingIntervalLength - Length of the interval for that the workload should be scheduled in simulation time.

      • setShiftingPowerFraction

        public void setShiftingPowerFraction​(double shiftingFraction)
        Sets the shifting fraction parameter of the power demand flexibility provision configuration of the scheduling strategy that is used to schedule DR events.
        Parameters:
        shiftingFraction - Shifting fraction that should be configured.

      • getShiftingPowerFraction

        public double getShiftingPowerFraction​()
        Retrieves the shifting fraction that is currently configured in the scheduling strategy that is used to schedule DR events.
        Returns:
        Currently configured shifting fraction.

      • setDVFSScalingFrequency

        public void setDVFSScalingFrequency​(double scalingFrequency)
        Sets the scaling frequency parameter of the power demand flexibility provision configuration of the scheduling strategy that is used to schedule DR events.
        Parameters:
        scalingFrequency - Scaling frequency that should be configured.

      • getScalingFrequency

        public double getScalingFrequency​()
        Retrieves the scaling frequency that is currently configured in the scheduling strategy that is used to schedule DR events.
        Returns:
        Currently configured scaling frequency.

      • setPreviouslyShiftedNodeStepSum

        public void setPreviouslyShiftedNodeStepSum​(int shiftedNodeSteps)
        Sets the amount of node steps that were shifted in the previously tried configuration of the power demand flexibility provision. This method is only used by the DREventHandler component, during the optimization of the additional costs that are caused by power demand flexibility provision.
        Parameters:
        shiftedNodeSteps - Amount of node steps that were shifted in the last tried combination.

      • checkPowerConsumptionBound

        private boolean checkPowerConsumptionBound​(DC handledDC,
                                           double powerConsumptionBound,
                                           ReserveProvisionType provisionType,
                                           int schedulingInterval)
